intro: Ruellia mcvaughii, commonly known as McVaugh's ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from blue to purple, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ruellia mcvaughii is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
